newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank boosts foreign exchange business.
newsitem.headline: China bank boosts foreign exchange business.

text.p: The China Construction Bank saw profits of $125.66 million from its foreign exchange business in the first half, up $34.86 million or 38.4 percent compared with the same period last year, the China Daily said on Thursday.
International settlements business in January-June was $22.56 billion, up $7.28 billion, or 47.6 percent, year-on-year, it said.
Total foreign exchange business in the first half reached $12.422 billion, up 71.7 percent compared with the same period in 1996, it said.
The bank had also been more aggressive in attracting foreign exchange deposits, it said.
By end-June, the bank's outstanding foreign exchange savings totalled $6.651 billion, up from $6.105 billion at the same time last year, it said.
Investment banking had become a new growth area for the bank, which now provided services such as financial consulting, investment arrangement and guarantees for infrastructure projects, it said.
The bank had raised funds on the international market through government loans, export credit, commercial loans and bond insurance, it said.
